When it is translated as spirit , its context has ( more naturally ) a religious tone , including words such as sanctus ( holy ) and omnipotens ( all - powerful ) .If we are confronted with an instance of spiritus in a sentence for which we have no translation , we can disambiguate it as either spirit or wind by looking at its context in the original Latin .

Application deadline is Friday 20th August , 2004 .Traditionally , rich constraint - based grammars such as LFG and HPSG have been hand - crafted .Scaling such grammars to unrestricted text is time - consuming and expensive .Recently ( Cahill , Burke , O'Donovan , van Genabith and Way , 2004 ) and ( Miyao and Tsujii , 2004 ) have shown how rich LFG and HPSG resources can be acquired from treebanks .
